Articles.Content: My greetings to you and Russia my friend.

My greetings to you and Russia my friend.

I really don't understand you about window

You have right because you don't understand me...i think the window must be look front not the VAB,but i think i do wrong!!!

The really Vostok has the window to this side?

I ask sorry!
The real Vostok had a window in front of the seat, with control panels off to the sides...believe me, I saw the mock-up in Moscow...

Agreed. In fact, by the time the 4th launch had failed, the scientists had actually fixed the problems which had caused the failures in the engines - however, the Kremlin had lost patience with the Soviet space program and refused to invest in another N-1, which was massively expensive. The project was canned and the parts were ordered to be scrapped, however the scientists hid the engines as they were literally cutting edge. One of these were tested by america in the '90s by lockheed martin and not only did it work perfectly, it actually performed much better than their own rockets.

In fact, they are used all over the place apparently:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NK-15#Current_and_proposed_uses

I believe my next suggestions have base to the really Vostok 3KA.

Suggestion first:

And i find a diference to the navball,inside of IVA and outside:
the soyuz launcher used for the vostock missions didnt have the blok i third stage.
I have one suggestion for the N-1: the B-V decoupler should be equipped with the reaction wheels. It's quite difficult to fly this enormous rocket using only reaction wheels and RCS from Soyuz.

the soyuz launcher used for the vostock missions didnt have the blok i third stage.

...i used this about my test flights with the Vostok,sometimes i used and the Saturn V or mixed parts both of them...

the soyuz launcher used for the vostock missions didnt have the blok i third stage.

errr, no soyuz launchers were used for vostoK missions, but R7 derivatives named Vostok-K (cause the Soyuz, even whilst being most flown rocket of the R7 series, still is only a derivative of the R7)

and what can you place instead of Blok I, if there is no Blok E?!
yup, the vostok 8K72K used a small upper stage with a single engine, under the capsule, powered by a RD-0109 engine - stage which ended up to be named vostok-Block E
I'm already working on Block E
